fields.name: observation_id
fields.description: A unique identifier of an observation within a project.

fields.name: deployment_id
fields.description: The unique identifier of the deployment this observation belongs to. Foreign key to `deployment:deployment_id`.

fields.name: event_id
fields.description: The unique identifier of the event (collection of multimedia files) that is the source of this observation. Foreign key to `media:event_id`.

fields.name: media_id
fields.description: The unique identifier of the multimedia file that is the source of this observation. Foreign key to `media:media_id`. Use only for file-based observations.

fields.name: observation_type
fields.description: Type of observation. All categories in this vocabulary have to be understandable from an AI point of view. `Undefined` describes classifications with a confidence level below some predefined threshold i.e. neither humans nor AI can say what was recorded.

fields.name: scientific_name
fields.description: A scientific name of identified species.

fields.name: vernacular_name
fields.description: A common name of identified species (preferably in English).

fields.name: count
fields.description: Number of individuals identified (optionally of given age, sex and behaviour; see below). Interpretation depends on the value of `sequence_based` field.

fields.name: count_new
fields.description: Number of 'NEW' individuals identified for this file taking into account the entire sequence (optionally of given age, sex and behaviour; see below).

fields.name: individual_id
fields.description: Individual animal unique identifier within this project.

fields.name: classified_by
fields.description: Name or a unique identifier of a person or AI algorithm that classified this observation.

fields.name: classification_confidence
fields.description: How accurate is this classification? Specified as probability (provide an approximate value for human classifications).

fields.name: classification_date
fields.description: Date and time when this classification was made, as an ISO 8601 formatted string in UTC (e.g. `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`).

fields.name: _id
fields.description: Internal attribute of data management system: ID of this observation.
